revised_title: Boris Petrovitch Uvarov: A Pioneering Entomologist and Locust Expert
tldr: Boris Petrovitch Uvarov was a renowned Russian entomologist who made significant contributions to the fields of taxonomy, zoology, and biogeography. He is best known for his work on locusts and grasshoppers, including his theory of locust phases and his efforts in organizing international anti-locust conferences. Uvarov's extensive research and publications on Orthoptera taxonomy have had a lasting impact on the field of entomology.
